intro: Lepidium bonariense var. pseudovirginicum, commonly known as the false peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, often forming dense mats. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
